summary: Jon is the most honorable and worth  man in whole ASOIAF. His personality  is the most important detail  in whole  book/show...
body:
Jon is the most honorable and worth man in whole ASOIAF. His personality is the most important detail in whole book/show

And please leave to hurt his personality , please just stop hurt to his character because of your dirty mind and illusions

Jon isn’t a lier . He never ever dishonour woman. He will never ever hurt woman who save his life. Who risked her and her son’s life for him.

Just stop to dishonored his personality because of your dirty imbecile mind.

I hate this people do you know why? Not because they are shipping Nonsa/Jonsa.

Because they are dirty, sick , unworthy people who try to defeat the most honorable men’s person because their sickness illusions.

“Jon is a lier. Jon is a unhonorable man, Jon lied a woman, Jon sleep with woman for ambitions, he tried to maniputate with woman…”

Whaaaaaaat? Your sickness is unbelievable people. Dream what you want but just take your dirty hand and mind from Jon.

Just respect his person and ideals. Just respect him.

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

summary: The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen...
caption:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

Arya sipped at her tankard cautiously, between spoonfuls of pie still warm from the oven. Her father sometimes let them have a cup of beer, she remembered. Sansa used to make a face at the taste and say that wine was ever so much finer, but Arya had liked it well enough. It made her sad to think of Sansa and her father. (Arya II, ACoK)

And then about Alysanne:
Lord Manderly entertained the queen lavishly. At the welcoming feast an entire aurochs was roasted, and his lordship’s daughter Jessamyn acted as the queen’s cupbearer, filling her tankard with a strong northern ale that Her Grace pronounced finer than any wine she had ever tasted.
~*~

- Alysanne wasn’t raised with the expectation that she would be Queen. She had an older sister already married off several times in violent and political marriages.

- Alysanne was the youngest living daughter of King Aenys I Targaryen.

- Alysanne was 12 years old when her brother became king. Arya will turn 12 in Winds of Winter, when Jon becomes KiTN

It’s just so interesting looking back on what Arya told her Father about her future.

“Can I be a King’s Councillor and build castles and become the High Septon?”

Ned tells her she will marry a King and rule his Castle, and will possibly have a child that may become the High Septon.


The above Arya quote is key and strongly relates to Queen Alysanne.

- Alysanne was a dragonrider who loved to fly. *Arya also expresses a desire to fly several times. She says she wants to turn into a wolf with wings

- Alysanne is a keen archer and hunter. Very “tomboy” and unlady-like activities. Arya has demonstrated all these traits. She has hunted and in the show is an expert archer.

- Queen Alysanne enjoyed physical activity (a quality that would have appealed to her brother Jaehaerys, who was reputed to be a fine dragonrider as well as a skilled archer and horseman). They spent many years growing up together before Jaehaerys became King.

- Alysanne married her brother Jaehaerys and became Queen. She was also the  King’s most trusted Counsellor. A role Arya says she wants in her future when Ned tells her she will marry a King.

- Alysanne was loved by the smallfolk. She lived amongst them even after becoming Queen.


“Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody.“

And:

Arya had loved nothing better than to sit at her farthers table and listen to them talk. She had loved listening to the men on the benches too; to freeriders tough as leather, courtly knights and bold young squires, and gizzeld old men at arms.”

Arya, even while being brainwashed by the FM, she is still a social butterfly. Still making friends where ever she went. It’s interesting she preferred Cat of the Canals of all of her disguises. Sidenote: In her backstory for Cat, Arya actually says that Cat arrived to Braavos on ship named Nymeria.


“She missed the friends she’d had when she was Cat of the Canals; Old Brusco with his bad back, his daughters Talea and Brea, the mummers from the Ship, Merry and her whores at the Happy Port, all the other rogues and wharfside scum. She missed Cat herself the most of all, even more than she missed her eyes. She had liked being Cat, more than she had ever liked being Salty or Squab or Weasel or Arry.”

Queen Alysanne planned and funded the building of a Castle called Deep Lake. She had Queensgate named in her honor. Arya wants to build Castles

Alysanne was a fierce believer in woman’s rights and actively changed societies standards. “Alysanne saw no reason why a man should be favored over a woman”. Which is something Arya strongly believes in and has even told Jon directly when Arya said a woman is equal to a man.
caption_abstract:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

blog.name: kwonbomi
blog.description: Multi-fandom blog. Occasional art blog. ART TAG Currently Jonerys trash. SasuSaku is my guilty pleasure. Disney is my inspiration.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: pregnancy reveal or something? IDK, in my barely functioning mom brain my thought process was like “Sooo she’s going to get hurt...
caption:
pregnancy reveal or something? IDK, in my barely functioning mom brain my thought process was like “Sooo she’s going to get hurt and fall from drogon or something which will bring her to seeing a maester (or you know, Sam) who will inform her that BOOM she’s with child and she’ll be in denial and shock and worry for the future of their child in the midst of war etc etc, Jon will give her some reassuring words and it will be all romantic and sweet.” Something along those lines anyways…

I don’t know wtf she’s wearing right now tbh… a slip dress or something?… i just needed to draw her wearing some that could still imply that she she’s injured (hence the bandages around her arm and the few cuts/scratches… although in reality i’m sure her injuries would be far worse after falling off a dragon lol)

summary:
Dany: I identify as morosexual. I’m attracted to dumbasses and dumbasses only
Jon: how about I go north alone to steal a wight...
body:
Dany: I identify as morosexual. I’m attracted to dumbasses and dumbasses only

Jon: how about I go north alone to steal a wight so we can convince Cersei to fight for us?

Dany, taking off her clothes: gods jon you’re so fucking stupid

summary: What are your thoughts on a world where Arya is Wardeness of the North and Sansa is Lady of Winterfell? I saw someone on reddit...
question: What are your thoughts on a world where Arya is Wardeness of the North and Sansa is Lady of Winterfell? I saw someone on reddit speculate about it since Sansa is currently v much higher than her sister in role and title, and that would even the playing field. It could even work in book canon, with them playing the roles for either a young Rickon or Bran (although if it was  Bran, Sansa's role would obviously be more Lady Stark than Lord Stark -esque).
answer: I don’t see either of them taking authority positions over their brothers at the moment. First of all, they’re all super close in age; there’s no need for them to assume power when Bran is nearly as old, and has actual experienced people around him to help. Second, neither girl has the experience that Bran has to be able to take on those roles over him. Bran has actually dealt with the politics of Winterfell firsthand as acting lord. Nothing Sansa or Arya can do will trump that experience or knowledge. Third of all, Jon is (or will be, if we’re talking the books) alive, and he has extensive experience in leadership and northern-based politics. Sticking Arya and Sansa in these roles (at least right now) makes zero sense when their remaining brothers have a combined political career that has dealt with battle, food rations, delegation, execution, sacrifice, negotiations, etc.

summary: What do you think is the best/most positive trait of each Stark pre-ASOIAF/early GOT (+ Theon; including dead ones)?
question: What do you think is the best/most positive trait of each Stark pre-ASOIAF/early GOT (+ Theon; including dead ones)?
answer:
I’m just going to do Ned’s generation, his children, and Theon!

Brandon: his wild fury; unfortunately it’s something that the Mad King kills him for, but the utter hurricane that was his love for his sister is just so beautiful—you have a man about to be married but instead he storms into King’s Landing, metaphorical guns blazing, all to save his little sister

Ned: his loyalty; what he does for his sister is so beautiful, and it’s informed by the utter devotion with which he navigates that relationship (when Lyanna is dead and alive)—he raises Jon as his own son, teaching and giving him all that he is able to, to the detriment of his own matrimonial peace

Benjen: his sacrificial nature; it’s implied he joined the Night’s Watch because of what happened to his sister, brother, and father—a young boy (with a place in Winterfell) willingly sends himself away to the freezing Wall for the rest of his life; we can see this nature shine through when he laments that Jon is not his son

Lyanna: her kindness; one of my favorite stories about her is when she helped Howland Reed—this was a man she didn’t know, but she stood up for him, clothed him, befriended him, when she had absolutely no obligation to; in fact, she likely would have been advised against doing so given her political stature

Robb: political savvy; of course (from our perspective) it sucks that he was not willing to trade Jaime for his sisters, but that was an unbelievably hard (and smart) decision to make—Robb deeply loves his family, but he also knows he must take care of his people, and he doesn’t allow his own desires (in this moment) to outrank those of his followers

Jon: I love how he’s this patchwork doll of the previous generation’s best qualities—the sacrificial nature, the kindness toward those considered beneath him, his loyalty, his wildness; above all, I think his pragmatism is his best quality; Jon is crazy smart, analytical, logical, all the makings of a formidable leader

Sansa: her adaptation; objectively, I love (and root for) how Sansa lies to protect herself in these situations where she is isolated from family and friends—it’s that feeling akin to watching a horror movie, when you’re begging the character to just be smart; I’ve felt like that many times especially when Sansa was with Joffrey, like “Just say what you have to to please him”

Arya: her Machiavellinism; like shit, her intelligence and creativity make for a wicked combination, and we can the fruits of this cunning in how she tricked Jaqen, how she found out about the kindly man when she was blind, how she executed her Mercy murder, etc.—its almost disturbing how able she is to amalgamate her smarts and her imagination to produce this knife-sharp guile

Bran: his sweetness; it would be so easy for the world to strip him of this, especially in light of losing the function of his legs, but Bran remains so, so sweet to those he loves—Luwin and Hodor and Osha, he just possesses this sweetness that is rare in that kind of world and I think it’s a beautiful thing to have

Rickon: we know little about him, but his wildness is almost unparalleled, but it’s so admirable; he really embraces that wild wolf part of him, allows Shaggy’s presence to protect him from harm, both physical and emotional—it’s probably not purposeful as he’s so young, but that ingrained dual-consciousness only makes his wildness better

Theon: his love for Robb; he betrays him of course, but I love seeing how often Theon thinks of Robb—his brother at heart—how he regrets leaving him, letting him die alone; it’s one of the best (platonic) love stories in ASOIAF in my opinion

blog.name: hypomone535
blog.title: Dream of Ice and Fire
blog.description:
I am a Stark of Winterfell

I am a writer of Jonsa

body:
Over the moon 🙋‍♀️🙏🏻❤️

“A lot of tears. I think, you know, as an actor it was really satisfying — I think for everyone, everyone’s storylines — to be able to act out the way that it all ends. It was really satisfying for us,” Turner said. “Who knows if it will be satisfying for the fans.

I think a lot of fans will be disappointed and a lot of fans will be over the moon, I think. I think it will be really interesting to see people’s reactions,

but for me reading the script it was just like heartbreaking to read at the very final page of the script it just says, ‘End of Game of Thrones’. That was really emotional.”

-Sophie Turner an interview with IGN

reblog.comment:

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

body:
Killer Jon

I may be the only person who feels this way but one major hope I have for season 8 that most definitely won’t happen but obviously should, is for my baby Jon Snow Aegon Targaryen to kill this motherfucker:

I don’t give a fuck about Clegane Bowl. Sorry guys but my panties just don’t get wet over that one. I also don’t care about Arya’s 7-year-old list of names with his in red underlined. I know it’s what will happen and I’m sure it will be epic.



BUT…


This is the one undead asshole Jon Aegon TOTALLY needs to fucking kill.


For baby Egg.

For Rhaenys.

For Elia.


Oberyn was unsuccessful because he was a cocky motherfucker.

Avenge your family, Jonaegon! Kill that ugly fucker DED!!!!!!

(And then when you’re done, go home and fuck your hot wife)

summary: When pirates threaten your existence, how far would you go to fight for what you believe? For those you care about? Monarchs...
caption:
When pirates threaten your existence, how far would you go to fight for what you believe? For those you care about? Monarchs take harsh measures to contain the advance of piracy. But the measure backfires. Now, royal families watch the gruesome consequences of the actions, drowning nations in panic. Who could be the next heir to disappear?

               An appless royals/pirates pairs smut rp (a little bit of everything)

home. ~ navi. ~ characters. ~ pairs. ~ taken fcs. ~ app.
